entry.string: This module allows you to schedule Xaraya jobs at certain times of the day/week/month (cron)
entry.translation: Thees mudoole-a elloos yuoo tu schedoole-a Xereya jubs et certeeen teemes ooff zee dey/veek/munt (crun)

entry.string: Those jobs could be for instance :
entry.translation: Thuse-a jubs cuoold be-a fur instunce-a :

entry.string: doing a backup of the database
entry.translation: dueeng a beckoop ooff zee detebese

entry.string: The scheduler module relies on other modules to actually execute whatever jobs are scheduled, so first you need to find out which module functions can be scheduled.
entry.translation: Zee schedooler mudoole-a releees oon oozeer mudooles tu ectooelly ixecoote-a vhetefer jubs ere-a schedooled, su furst yuoo need tu feend oooot vheech mudoole-a fooncshuns cun be-a schedooled. Bork bork bork!

entry.string:
Then you need some kind of trigger to wake up the scheduler - this can be done e.g. by requesting a specific webpage automatically from your own system via a Unix cron entry or Windows AT command, or via a web-based scheduler service like http://webcron.org/, or (if you really have no other choice) by relying on web hits from your visitors if your site is relatively busy.

The rest will be handled by the scheduler module :-)
entry.translation:
Zeen yuoo need sume-a keend ooff treegger tu veke-a up zee schedooler - thees cun be-a dune-a i.g. by reqooesteeng a speceeffic vebpege-a ootumeteecelly frum yuoor oovn system feea a Uneex crun intry oor Veendoos ET cummund, oor feea a veb-besed schedooler serfeece-a leeke-a http://webcron.org/, oor (iff yuoo reelly hefe-a nu oozeer chueece-a) by relyeeng oon veb heets frum yuoor feesiturs iff yuoor seete-a is releteefely boosy. Bork bork bork!

Zee rest veell be-a hundled by zee schedooler mudoole-a :-)

entry.string: Extended information about this module can be found here. [modules module]
entry.translation: Extended inffurmeshun ebuoot thees mudoole-a cun be-a fuoond here-a. [mudooles mudoole-a]
